labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to transform documentation from GitHub repositories or websites into LLM-friendly prompts. Its core functionality revolves around retrieving documentation and converting it into a format that enhances LLM applications by providing better context and understanding. The available tools, get_docs2prompt_docs and get_url_docs, specifically focus on fetching documentation from GitHub repos or direct URLs, which can then be repurposed for prompt generation.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality aligns most closely with "Content Creation" as the server processes documentation to create LLM prompts, which can be considered a form of content transformation. Additionally, the tools are heavily focused on web-based document retrieval, which overlaps with "Web Search & Research". No custom label is necessary as the predefined categories sufficiently cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: get_docs2prompt_docs
tools.description:
Use this tool to get the documentation from a GitHub repository.

    Args:
        github_repo: The GitHub repository to get the documentation for.

tools.name: get_url_docs
tools.description:
Use this tool to get the documentation at a URL.

    Args:
        url: The URL to get the documentation for.

server_info_crawled.name: docs2prompt
server_info_crawled.author: @Melbourneandrew/docs2prompt-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Transform documentation from GitHub repositories or dedicated websites into LLM-friendly prompts. Enhance your LLM applications by seamlessly integrating documentation as prompts for better context and understanding.

tools.name: get_docs2prompt_docs
tools.description:
Use this tool to get the documentation from a GitHub repository.

    Args:
        github_repo: The GitHub repository to get the documentation for.

tools.name: get_url_docs
tools.description:
Use this tool to get the documentation at a URL.

    Args:
        url: The URL to get the documentation for.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Melbourneandrew/docs2prompt-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
